critique: This document approves a "Code of Fair Competition for the End Grain Strip Wood Block Industry" under the National Industrial Recovery Act. This act is a hallmark of FDR's New Deal, which was designed to combat the Great Depression through government intervention in the economy. The document itself doesn't express explicit opinions on social issues, immigration, or civil liberties, but its economic focus provides insight into its ideological leaning. It centralizes power in the federal government through industry regulation.
